Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: WrexhamRealist
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel as a result of other reviews and found them 100% accurate. Modern hotel, immaculately clean and in a great location. Friendly and helpful staff with excellent english. Hotel only seems to do breakfast and bar type snacks but there are many cafes and bars within minutes. Hotel breakfast is buffet style bit pricey at 14 euros per head, so we went to Starbucks or Macs both within 10 mins on Friedrichstrasse. This was our first trip to Berlin, loads to do and easy to navigate either on foot or using the excellent railway system. Restaurant wise we recommend Maximillians a few streets up past Checkpoint Charlie, so good we went there twice.

Reviews.Title: “great city”
Reviews.Author: mac1818
Reviews.Content: Had a great mid week break with brother hotel was great clean and staff Very helpful thanks to Sebastian who drew us maps gave great advise on use of metro and where to go and where not to go nothing was to much trouble for him a credit to the hotel shall return thanks again

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: kb0503
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a couple of nights during our second stint in Berlin. Rooms are very modern and clean, though a little on the small side. Location is good - there are a number of cafes/restaurants nearby, nothing fancy but good for a quick breakfast. Also about a 5 min walk to Checkpoint Charlie and the Kochstrasse U-Bahn station, which is good, but you will have to change trains to travel east/west. On the whole, staff was very friendly, although room cleaning came around 5pm, which we thought was a little odd. We ate at the hotel buffet before we checked out because we had an early flight to catch, and it was really excellent - wish we had more time to enjoy it. Free wifi in the lobby was also very useful.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel in Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: terry j
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights from march 4th 2012, The rooms were comfortable and spotlessly clean, although it would of been nice to have tea making facilities in the room. We found the staff friendly, attentive and very helpful, We didn't eat in the hotel, their are many cafe's, coffee bars and restaurants nearby, but did enjoy pre dinner drinks in the very pleasant bar area. The hotel is ideally situated, very close to the U bahn giving easy access to all the sights of this marvellous city as well as to both airports. Good value for money, would definatly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Carl_and_Lesley
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at Winters Hotel Mitte Am Checkpoint Charlie. The hotel is clean and tidy, and the reception area is really stylish and well laid out. The staff were really friendly and helpful, and spoke exceptionally good English. The rooms were clean and comfortable. I would agree with some of the other reviews in that our room did have a slightly smokey smell, but it was practically unnoticeable. Also, we had a room at the front of the hotel, and we did not find it noisey. On the contrary, we slept like babies each night we were there!! The beds were heavenly (especially after a day of trekking around Berlin's beautiful sights), and the bathroom was spotless. The hotel is really conveniently located, within 2 minutes walking distance of Kochstraße Ubahn station (U6 line), and less than 5 minutes from Checkpoint Charlie. I could not recommend this hotel highly enough. Price-wise, service-wise, and location-wise, I don't think I've stayed in a better hotel for a city break. If you decide to stay in this hotel, I promise you will not be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Matthew H
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Winters Hotel for new year on a deal with LateRooms, and found the hotel everything you would need from a city hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was a good size, the bathroom was smart and it was incredibly clean and the breakfast was good. Location was convenient, not the prettiest part of town but plenty going on. The only downside was our bedroom permanently smelled of cigarettes which was odd considering neither of us smoke. All in all great hotel, would use again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels of its class I have stayed in Europe”
Reviews.Author: engped
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located in a central area. Near subway stations and also Checkpoint Charlie which usually is a point of interest. In the hotel, rooms are excellent and amenities provided make a difference. Some restaurants are close enough that you can walk. Never tried food at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: nz_uk323
Reviews.Content: An excellent, excellent hotel - having stayed at approximately ten or so four-star hotels around Europe this year, this one has been the best by far. Very central yet quiet location, beautiful room with comfortable bedding, attentive and friendly staff (all we encountered spoke very good English, which was so helpful as our German is unfortunately rather basic), free internet in the lobby and all for an extremely reasonable price. Would stay here again in a heartbeat - highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ideal”
Reviews.Author: alandooleyuk
Reviews.Content: Easy to find using the U and S Bahn from the Airport. Staff enjoy speaking good English - sadly our German was very limited. Room and bathrooms especially top class for the rate. It was really cold when we visited too but the hotel was quite warm. Quiet location but quite central for Berlin with good transport access. Some acceptable restaurants within walking distance, and a buffet breakfast at the hotel (extra charge)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Fernando84
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel, clean and with friendly staff. Really close to Checkpoint Charlie, its museum and lots of the main attractions in Berlin. The room was not that great, but the location more than compensated for that.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great - rude staff”
Reviews.Author: E S
Reviews.Content: Got charged 25 euros for having a 'highly polluted' room which turned out was due to soap in the shower and sink. Staff were rude and would not give us an adequate explanation for this until we needed to check out. We go told that we should be grateful as we looked poor so they charged us 25, otherwise they would have charged us 50 euros. Apart from that the room was quite small but nice inside and it is a good location. Certainly won't be going there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel indeed”
Reviews.Author: Julia M
Reviews.Content: The hotel and rooms were very clean and the staff at reception and the restaurant were very helpful. The breakfast (self serve) had plenty of variety and was of very good quality. We stayed for 3 nights. This was our first visit to Berlin. The location of the hotel was ideal. We took the train (S and then U bahn) from the airport which was so easy and cheap. We found Berlin to be a clean, vibrant and safe city and hope to visit again as there is so much to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “new,clean and efficient”
Reviews.Author: averagebloke37
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 nights with my wife,cost £252 for room only. Room was clean with lovely bathroom.Staff were helpful and spoke good english. The location is north of Mitte and idea for ubahn underground.6 euros buys a day pass for the transport system which is excellent. One were of caution,arrived late on easy jet flight and found our selves at friedrich strasse underground, nearly mugged but saved by extra people turning up.apart from that berlin safe and wonderful. enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - just a few points”
Reviews.Author: philmo99
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a colleague for 2 nights whilst visiting IFA. The hotel location whilst not scenice was fine, and within easy reach of the subway (and Checkpoint Charlie). If you like a walk you could also reach the City centre. The room was fine, clean - with a great shower. I would of liked Air conditioning, as it was a warm night. The breakfast buffet was fine, and was the service at reception. The bar service was a little slow, as was the reception area internet connectino - this was actually very slow. But I guess as a free service I should not complain too much. I did not use the Wifi service, which I think you do pay for. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, within walking distance of main sights”
Reviews.Author: BluebirdFACup08
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a room only basis, our good sized room on the 3rd floor overlooked a central court yard, which was quite noisy in the mornings because the kitchen was situated there. Only know that because we had to leave a window open as there is no air con and the weather was extremely warm. Room consisted of twin beds, wardrobe (only 10 hangers) also safe deposit box (free) and dressing table. Good, clean bathroom with shower. Pleasant lounge/bar area, which closed at 1am, although I think if there were a lot of residents using it they might have stayed open a bit longer. Dining room only offered breakfast, at a cost of 12euros pp however, there are plenty of cafes nearby. The hotel is in a street which cross sects the 2 main east/west roads. On one you will find Checkpoint Charlie and on the other, a large section of the Berlin Wall and an open air exhibition. A 3rd street nearby takes you straight to Potzdamer Platz. Around another corner is the Jewish museum and It is only a 15/20 minute walk to the Brandenburg Gate. For the shopper it is a paradise with most of the designer labels represented, however the gift shops range from tacky to repetitive. We traveled from Tegel airport by taxi, which can be found outside the main arrivals hall, it cost 25 euros. The return taxi cost 19 euros and we were given a guided tour by the driver all the way back to the airport. While public transport is a lot cheaper, approx 2 euros I understand, I believe you cannot do the journey without making a change. My husband and I didn't want the fuss so opted to use the cream taxis (I think you also get a feel for the attitude of the locals this way too). The reception staff were very helpful, polite and efficient printing out our return boarding passes and ordering a taxi for us. Would highly recommend this hotel because of its access to everything a visitor would want to see, but it is far enough away from the noise and bustle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great price to value”
Reviews.Author: Alex_Alpern
Reviews.Content: Was there in April. Room was modern, well furnished and clean. The location is good, walking distance to major city attractions. The staff was helpful and I enjoyed the breakfast. The only point I disliked was lack of free WiFi. However, the price was reasonable. Would stay there again for the next time.

Reviews.Title: “discommunucation”
Reviews.Author: yoavbTelAviv
Reviews.Content: overall hotel is ok. clean rooms, breakfast is what you expect, location is also ok...problem begun as I tried to connect to the wireless connection. didn't work. same problem with the cable connection. the recepsionist was willing to help at the beggining, but didn't try to hard. instead he blamed it on my computer and then on my employer that blocked my connection options(!?). when I argued that I communicated with the same computer all over the world, including this very hotel' and that other guests have the same problem, he said rudely: "I'm not an IT expert". there were 2 computers in the lobby, but it took them so long to go from one page to another, that I gave up and went looking for an internet cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: bureau1103
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a couple of days in December last year when it started snowing early. I arrived by train at the Berlin Hbf and took the taxi to the hotel. It took no more than 15 minutes from the train station to the hotel. The closest U-Bahn is Kochstraße, it is around 2 blocks from the hotel, close enough and convenient. Another block and you are at Check Point Charlie. There were a few choices of places to eat near the vicinity. One or two convenience stores nearby and a small supermarket towards Check Point Charlie. I very much like the modern and clean design of the hotel and the rooms. I stayed at a standard single room. The size of the room and bathroom was good for for a solo traveler. The bathroom had very nice fittings, clean and shiny. The €12 breakfast buffet was worth the money. The spread included choices of bread, cereals, cold cuts, cheese, tea, juices, salads, egg and sausages among others. Internet and WiFi access were not included in the price. There was however 2 computers at the lobby free for use and a printer as bonus. I had some difficulty using the hotel's electronic door lock. My card key was checked at the lobby and works perfectly except for the door lock to the room. Was a challenge opening the door to the room but was able to find a solution to it. One of the reasons I was in Germany was to visit the Christmas Markets. 2 U-Bahn stations away at Französische Straße is the Gendarmenmarkt. One of the nicest markets around. After having a good dinner at the market I walked back to the hotel! And if you love chocolates, Fassbender & Rausch Chocolatiers is a stop away at U-Bahn Stadtmitte. For what I paid for, this hotel is good to very good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - will stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: FrederickFirefly
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for four nights. The staff were very friendly, welcoming, knowledgeable and helpful at all times. They all spoke perfect English and joked with us about our not so perfect German! When we arrived, we were a little early so they held our suitcases for us at the hotel while we hunted down some food and drink. They also held our suitcases after we had checked out, as our flight wasn't until 6.30pm so we could get in some last minute shopping! The room was very clean and pleasant to spend time in (though I did miss the tea and coffee making facilities that I would expect in a British hotel). The breakfast was brilliant. All sorts of items were included - yogurt, cereal, breads, cheeses, meats, sausages, scrambled egg, pancakes, fruit, fresh coffee and juices and all provided within a lengthy time slot so no rushing downstairs for those who like a little lie-in! The hotel is just off Friedrichstrasse and not too far from the S-Bahn or local shops and pubs so we found it to be very well placed. It was in a quite quiet area, too, so no disturbances at night or from the other guests. We will definitely be visiting this hotel again, on our next trip to Berlin. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat for the price”
Reviews.Author: Lorien77
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the location of this hotel...within walking distance to Checkpoint Charlie and the subway as well as shoping and restaurants. It's also affordable, clean, and modern. My only issues are 1. noise from the street (if you're on that side of the hotel) and 2. the heat in the summer. We were SO hot we couldn't sleep well and of course when you open the window, you hear street noise. In cooler weather, these wouldn't be problems. Oh, and one more thing, a square toilet is not comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TravelBoy83
Reviews.Content: I spent only one night here in a single room. The hotel is only a few corners away from Checkpoint Charlie and has good transport links to U6, U1 and S-bahn services. Quite a few tourist attractions in the Potsdamer Platz and Stadtmitte area are within walking distance. Absolutely spotless clean, very nice decor and designer bathroom. Pleasant lounge, welcoming staff. Internet is cable in the room (chargeable), wireless in the lounge (chargeable). However, there is a few desktop computers in the reception area which can be used for free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: GOMCP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights in May/June 2011. Berlin is very hot, even in spring. The Hotel is modern - bordering on minimalist. The rooms, however, are comfortable, although there could be more “drawer space”. There is a safe in each room. The bathroom is very clean. However, the towels were on the small and thin side. For a “4-star” hotel we were surprised that the soap & shower gel were dispensers on the wall. The water was extremely hot, virtually instantaneously. The shower was very powerful – almost too powerful; if used at full power the head was forced back to such an extent that the water could go over the top of the partition. We found that full power is best used when held by hand. There was no Air-Con, which, for a modern hotel was a surprise. Our first room was at the front of the hotel and because of the heat (& lack of Air-Con) meant that the windows had to be left open. This meant that we were disturbed by traffic noise. The following morning we asked to be moved – this was no problem and we were moved with no fuss at all. So, avoid the front in Spring/Summer if you are a light sleeper - the back is very quiet – ask for the furthest courtyard , not one where kitchens are. Our package included breakfast – this was better that the usual Continental fare – there were a selection of hot food, fresh fruit, mueslis, cereals plus the usual ham and cheeses plus croissants. All were replenished regularly. All the staff (including cleaners) were all very helpful and cheerful. The hotel is convenient for (all within 10 minutes walk): Jewish Museum Checkpoint Charlie (+ Museum) Wall of Terror/Propaganda U-Bahn (Kochstrasse) Netto Supermarket (left out of the Hotel and second on left) Thai Restaurant (left out of the Hotel and on the first corner) – very nice fresh food Would we stay again: Yes for convenience & cleanliness, the downside is lack of Air-Con - there are probably other hotels that have Air-Con. Hints/Tips on Berlin: Reichstag – if you intend to go then you must apply at least three days before. (Yoy have to apply in writing or on-line.) TV Tower – well worth a visit – lunch is expensive, but worth it to see Berlin revolve below. Note that they confiscate all drinks before entry. Holocaust Memorial – they have scanners – so no Swiss Army Knives! U-Bahn - Get a Berlin Welcome Card – we had a 5-day one, but you can get 2 or 3 day Cards. It gives discounts on many museums and sites and covers public transport ( S & U-Bahn). The U-Bahn is clean. Get a U-Bahn map from a station – the maps in guide books and general maps were too small to read easily. You are never too far away from a station. Hop-on/off buses worth a day’s ticket just to get your bearings. Tempelhoff – a bit disappointing – the park (where the runways used to be) is nice – but we were expecting to visit the building – there are no official tours that we could find. Jewish Museum – interesting both in content and architecture. It opens at 10:00am and we would recommend going round as early as possible – there are many guided tours which can spoil the ambience.

Reviews.Title: “World's best hotel breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Lomalainen
Reviews.Content: Positive: Breakfast (the best ever!) Location Clean Newly renovated rooms Negative: Little too small room Male receptionist didn't understand English too well, gave wrong directions twice

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL, not a bad word to say about it!”
Reviews.Author: Annika2209
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing. Every single person at the front desk spoke perfect English and were more than happy to help you out. We arrived early on the first day and our room wasn't ready so we were invited to use the bathrooms to change and leave our luggage. 2 computers in reception for free internet access. We didn't eat here but the restaurant looked lovely. Everywhere was clean. Location was perfect, half hour walk to Brandenburg gate and restaurants. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: dk108
Reviews.Content: Everything was just perfect - room, facilities, very helpful staff, very good breakfast. Location of the hotel also was a plus for us. The little minor thing was no free wireless internet in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, simple hotel, practical and good location”
Reviews.Author: Gmartindale
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based mainly on price and were not disappointed. Pros, Excellent location if you dont mind a short walk to the main sights of Mitte. The nearest u-station is 5-10 minutes walk which is fine if you dont have any bags or such. Checkpoint Charlie is right around the corner but a longer walk to brandenburg gate and Unter den Linden Very clean Friendly staff on arrival and they helped with transport advice and maps etc. Cons Not particularly 'cosy'. Very practical if you just need a bed to sleep in, but not very homely The view from the front of the hotel is a not very nice tower block, residents can clearly see into the hotel rooms and vice-versa The hotel charges 9euro for parking per day in a small separate area at the end of the street. Parking on the street is free if you can find a spot. I'm not sure what advantage the 'car park' gains, there is no security and is further from the hotel Breakfast is 12 euros, good selection of food but depends on how much you normally like to eat. I think there is nothing particularly wrong with the hotel, but it was not very welcoming to come back to at night. There was no 'soul'. I think it depends on what you want from a hotel in Berlin, romantic weekend away with partner then you can find much better, simple hotel for sight seeing probably fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, friendly staff and well priced”
Reviews.Author: RobfromTheUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and was impressed! Initially there was a problem with my first room in that it was much smaller that my dad's and also smelt of something very unpleasant. Although there was nothing the hotel could do for the first night as they were fully booked, they moved me the next day into a much bigger room on the first floor, facing the street. Rooms with yellow décor are on the first floor, green décor are on the second floor, blue décor are on the third floor and red is fourth floor. I think the red rooms are the 'superior' rooms, as they appear to have balconies from the front of the hotel. The staff couldn't have been nicer or more apologetic about it and they dealt with it in a professional manner. The rooms at the back of the hotel face into a large court-yard with a plain brick wall for a view. I suggest you request a front facing room! The road that the hotel is on (Hedemannstraße) is a quiet residential road and doesn't get much traffic. The street intersects with Friedrichstraße (one of the main streets in Berlin) and therefore major attractions and things to see & do are easily accessible. The hotel itself is modern, very clean and despite previous reviews, the staff are friendly and helpful. Both rooms I had were clean, well appointed and well equipped. The beds are very comfortable, however the pillows are wafer thin and the duvets provided were in singles. Otherwise I slept very well. Breakfast (not included in the price: €12) was very nice and typically continental. Wide variety of cold meats, salads, veggies, cereals, bread rolls, scrambled eggs & bacon for the Brits. Along with something called Bircher muesli which I now need to work out how to make as it was seriously good!! The breakfast room is nicely bright & well furnished, however was also very stuffy and warm - even with windows open. Would suggest that you don't wear anything too warm in there! One thing amongst many that I liked about the hotel was the security. Each room has a safe with a digital lock and the rooms can only be accessed from the lobby/reception area by guests with a key card to open the main door. This would hopefully stop unwanted visitors. The hotel is approx a 5 min walk to the nearest U-Bahn station (Kochstraße) and Checkpoint Charlie. For the central area of Unter Den Linten, Brandenburg Gate and the Reichstag, I would allow 20-25 mins to walk it. Overall I would recommend this hotel. For the location, price and proximity to the major attractions I don't think you can do much better!

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied with stay”
Reviews.Author: Twix5
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend have just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel and I am hard put to fault the hotel, The location is excellent - just a few minutes walk from Checkpoint Charlie and Friedrichstrasse. The room was adequately sized and spotlessly clean and warm - very necessary as the February temperatures were freezing. Staff were friendly and spoke good English. The breakfast was 12 euros but worth it. Facilities generally very good. All in all excellent value. I would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean and well located”
Reviews.Author: HolidayLady016
Reviews.Content: Six of us, all adults, stayed at this hotel for three nights, three couples so therefore using three different rooms on different floors of the hotel. We all enjoyed our stay and experienced no problems what so ever. I was first impressed by how modern the hotel was, it reminded of ikea as it was quite minimal and new. The toilet in my room was in it's own little closet however the shower was in the main room, some of the glass was frosted but not all of it, which i liked and thought was a different idea. The rooms contained easy to use safety deposit boxes, which were a decent size. The room was very very clean and towels were changed regularly. I slept very well but i am used to sleeping with one pillow, my partner suffered a little due to needing two. I'm sure if we'd asked the hotel would have provided us with another pillow. The staff were friendly and helpful when we needed directions. The hotel was well located, we walked everywhere! All in all, brilliant value for money, brilliant hotel and brilliant break in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Clean and Convenient location but room small & rather thin walls”
Reviews.Author: yuen_clara
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. The building has been recently renovated and the room is modern, clean and cozy. It is also is very close to Checkpoint Charlie and to the U Barn. The downside with the hotel is that the room is on the small side - you can literally jump to bed as soon as you open the door and opening the wardrobe is tight with the study table next to it. Also, I can hear next door's showers when switched on or when doors are being opened/closed nearby. The receptionist is efficient but can do with being more personal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Quiet Location, but still close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Kman773
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very modern from the reception area to the rooms. Free internet but you pay a lot for breakfast, but the room price offsets the breakfast costs, which by the way,, the breakfast was great. Staff is very friendly, rooms are spotless. The location is more or less a few blocks from where the hustle and bustle of the city really begin. If you are arriving via train, you will need to take the U-bahn to Kochstrasse, you are then two blocks from the hotel. If you arrived at the central station you will need to take the S-bahn to Fredrichstrasse and then switch to the U-bahn. It may sound confussing but it isnt, it is a very quick trip and the whole Bahn system is easy to understand even if you dont speak German. You are only a block away from "check Point Charlie" Where, if you like, for a few Euro you can get your passport stamped, which I know a lot of people miss now. Overall it is a great value to stay here. You can walk to the gate (about 20 minutes) or take the U-bahn. Once you are up in this general area, you can see much of what people come to Berlin to see.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Statement-dk
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night. Good location and nice room. The one and only downside was that the hotel couldn´t (=wouldn´t) help to pay the taxi with cash when we arrived from the airport... (the hotel had our creditcard info at the time). But nice room and nice hotel and very cheap. Would use the same hotel next time in Berlin :-)

Reviews.Title: “ACE”
Reviews.Author: LewisY
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent stay at the winters hotel. I went with my partner and friends for a weekend, the price of the hotel was amazing, £50 a night and although it was a bit of the beaten path it was near Kreuzberg and in easy access of the metro, and taxis are cheap in Berlin. The rooms were clean and exceeded our expectations as they were modern and the beds were comfortable. The bar is open, as far as I can tell, all night! and the bar staff are very friendly. Berlin is an amazing city and I would highly recommend the WInters hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in ok location”
Reviews.Author: tuikku84
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Winter's for two nights and were pleased with our stay. The location is not perfect and hood not the nicest, but relatively central. The room had a good size and both the room and bathroom were clean. The room was not recently renovated, but was still in good shape. We ate breakfast at the hotel both mornings and had no complaints. It was in no way luxurious but what could be expected of a middle class hotel. All in all a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed ...”
Reviews.Author: steve_and_rachel
Reviews.Content: To be honest, despite the fact that we really enjoyed our holiday in Berlin (and would recommend this city to people), we were disappointed by our stay in this hotel. We stayed for 4 nights in June 2009, which cost just over 100 euros per night (for a standard double room). The room was clean and a good size, and breakfast was very good. However, each evening when we came back to the hotel, our room was very cold - i.e. cold enough to make us feel uncomfortable (and we're from London, so we're used to relatively cold temperatures). The problem was that the windows were opened (and left open) by the maids when they cleaned our room each afternoon, and the weather in Berlin was colder than normal for June (temperatures went as low as 5-10 degrees during our stay). This meant that when we returned each evening our room was very cold. Although there were radiators in the room, these didn't work, and when we asked at reception we were told that the heating was switched off at this time of the year. We understand that you wouldn't normally expect a hotel to have its heating switched on in June. However, when temperatures are lower than normal (they went as low as 5-10 degrees) you would expect a hotel to review its policy of having the heating switched off, or to review its policy of opening the windows in the rooms. Whatever the explanation, we didn't feel that it was acceptable for us to be uncomfortably cold in a hotel room, with no heating available, particularly when you are paying over 100 euros per night. We were also disappointed at several other aspects. A couple of things in the room didn't work (e.g. the desklight), and when we asked reception for blankets they forgot, so we had to go down and ask again. Although these were very minor issues, they're just not the sort of things you expect from a hotel when you're paying over 100 euros per night. In conclusion, because the room was cold with no heating available, we didn't feel that that the hotel provided a standard of accommodation that was acceptable, particularly considering that this is certainly not a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Born4travel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated not far from Checkpoint Charlie on Friedrichstrasse, which runs through the centre of Berlin Mitte. Most of the places of interest are within easy walking distance of the hotel. We used a taxi from Schonefeld airport for 26 euros as it was raining on arrival, we used the U Bahn once, other than that we walked. We had booked a standard room but on checking the internet I upgraded to a Superior room for 20 euros per day, well worth it. More room. The standard rooms would be OK for business use but not for more than 1 person. The hotel is kept very clean including the rooms & all the staff are more than helpful. Ask the reception staff to recommend places for you & it is done. They will book places & taxis. On recommendation of Trip Advisor reviews we did not eat in the hotel, we used a little cafe around the corner from the hotel called Delicious for breakfast. The owners were excellent & made us more than welcome. There are plenty of restaurants etc on or just off Friedrichstrasse. The 2 we used most were Sotto Sopra, Italian, & Maxilillians local bar/restaurant. The food & service in both was excellent. For interest the Ritter sports chocolate shop is on Franzozischier Strasse & well worth a visit. No hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent find”
Reviews.Author: Jack62
Reviews.Content: I've just stayed at this hotel with my dad (70 years) and sister. I booked it because a) it offered twin beds (surprisingly difficult to find) and b) if booked through Travel Republic breakfast is included. I was slightly concerned because the hotel is not in the main tourist area. However, this turned out to be a bonus. It is in a quiet residential area (opposite flats) but just 5 minutes walk from Checkpoint Charlie. (Berlin is small, so unlike London, nothing is more than a few minutes away.) There are several local cafes and restaurants in the neighbourhood which aren't particuarly touristy. The hotel itself is bright, modern and clean. Despite other visitors' comments, my sister and I thought our twin room was large. The bathroom was lovely and the shower was 'power' indeed! Fab! The only thing missing was a mini-bar, but as we weren't in the room enough for it to matter. I would recommend this hotel for anyone seeking a quiet location and stay in Berlin. It is ideal for the more discerning traveller. I used to live in Germany and wanted my sister, who was visting for the first time, to have a good impression of the country and its facilities. This hotel met all my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to explore Berlin”
Reviews.Author: sunnybunny7381
Reviews.Content: A basic yet modern hotel, in a good location although at first you may feel slightly out of the way until you realise you can walk from the hotel to most of the main tourist hotspots of Berlin. The U-bahn train line is just around the corner with stops all close by. The hotel seems to have been rennovated lately so is very clean and new, basic with only 1 pillow and randomly 1 cover per person (even though it is a double bed so you have 2 single covers rather than 1 duvet) but is all you need for a quick stay in Berlin as we were hardly in our room so it really was great value for money, excellent location and could not fault it at all really.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need for an enjoyable stay at a good price.”
Reviews.Author: 204hm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned a trip to Berlin and Paris for my 30th birthday, we started out in Berlin (we should have spent our whole time there, I never wanted to leave). Considering that we visited when Berlin was having the worst snow storm they'd had in 30 years, my husband wasn't so impressed, however this hotel was great! I speak German, however my husband does not and he had no problems talking to anyone in the hotel. The hotel was close to everything we wanted nearby; convenient to get to places a little further away. At first, we thought the room was small (but after spending time in Paris, we learned our room in Berlin was huge); very clean (they even folded pj's left on the bed); energy efficient (sensor corridor lights) and I liked their large dispensers for soap and shampoo instead of mini bottles. Sleeping at night was not a problem – very quiet and comfortable, although my husband and I were not used to having separate blankets. We got a great deal on this hotel through Expedia. Really enjoyed this hotel and would stay there again. Expedia photos accurately show the room in which we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect but ok if you can get it cheap”
Reviews.Author: gk141054
Reviews.Content: Eight of us stayed at this place recently for a lads holiday. The location isn't too bad at all - close to the metro line to get around Berlin and close to Checkpoint Charlie, loads of cafes and McDonalds / Starbucks are also nearby if thats your thing. We had 8 double rooms (all lastminute would let me book) but the week before the booking I called to confirm and change for 8 twin rooms. If they couldn't change then we would have shared but both times I called they confirmed they had changed the booking to twin rooms. Got there and surprise surprise we all had doubles. The rooms were all nice and modern though, great en-suite bathrooms. The bar in reception isn't great - we waited quite a while to be served because the receptionist also serves the beers (or did when we were there) so she poured two beers then disappeared for 10 minutes to server people at reception). Not the German efficiency I expected. Overall the staff were ok though, helpful enough when asked but nothing out of the ordinary. I got the rooms for about £85 per night through Last Minute as one of their "Top Secret" hotels so ok for that money. Would never pay the cost that they try and charge if you go direct though... Free Wi-Fi in the lobby was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: KatLLondon
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Winter's Hotel and I would recommend this to fellow travellers. The rooms were small but very modern and sylish with a nice bathroom. The TV did not have a good selection of English Speaking Channels though - Just the News. The staff were very helpful indeed, and this is a great hotel based on the location. Right by some of the major sites. We also found this on Last Minute for around 60 Euros a Night. The only other negative was that the breakfast was not included.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: 1globetrotterSweden
Reviews.Content: Design hotel in Berlin Mitte. Small double rooms, clean and great staff. No minibar and small tv's with a bad selection of international channels.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Yellow_Jumpsuit
Reviews.Content: I cannot rate this hotel highly enough. The staff were very friendly, the rooms were stylish and the location excellent!! Stayed for 4 nights and found the hotel to be in a brillaint location for most of the sights such as Checkpoint Charlie, TV Tower, Jewish memorial etc. Found deal on last minute.com and great value for money! Didn't eat in restaurant but it looked very nice from the outside.

Reviews.Title: “Value, value, value”
Reviews.Author: Piesp
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just a block away from the U-bahn-stop Kochstraße, so it's easy to get to and from. The receptionists all spoke good English and were all very serviceminded and helpful. Our flight from Berlin didn't leave until late evening, but the hotel helped us store our luggage for the day, even after we had checked out. We stayed in the superior room, a pretty large room with Internet access included. There was no problem getting the username/password for the Internet from the reception. The room was cleaned every day, and always looked great when we returned on the evenings. The bed was huge (180 cm) and good to sleep in. The bathroom was good looking and equipped with a hairdryer, shampoo and regular soap. The only things that could have been better were: - The WiFi didn't reach all the way up to the 4th floor. - The breakfast was not included, and costed 12 euros in the hotel restaurant. Too expencive for us, when a regular breakfast in Berlin costs about 7 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Canarius
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in July 2010 for 4 nights, and I cannot praise it highly enough. The location of the hotel is brilliant - only 5 minutes walk to the Kochstrasse U-Bahn station - perfect for accessing any part of the city. The hotel itself is very clean, very modern and the staff are very helpful. My room was exceptionally clean - looking over the inner courtyard it was incredibly quiet - no noise, no bars, no loud music. The bed was comfy and the satellite tv has about 30 channels - but the only english channels are CNN and BBC World Service. The only downsides I can think of is that there is that they only have a vending machine in the lobby for drinks etc. If you need shampoo etc I recommend you go to Kaisers supermarket (5 minutes walk - out of the hotel - turn left - left again at the end of the road). All in all a fabulous hotel and I will definitely use it again if I go back to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: zaheergb
Reviews.Content: great rooms, expcept that they gae another guest a key to my room, so checked both of us in to the same room. Staff were generally poor, and so was the bar int he lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Viajandoporai
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location, pretty close to the subway and to Checkpoint Charlie. The room was very nice, big and the extra bed was very confortable. The bath is too high so my father had problems to get into it, but apart from that, everything in the bedroom was great. We did not have breakfast in the hotel since it was not included in the price. The only problem is the lift (elevator). There is only one and you might have to wait some time to use it, especially in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for visiting Berlin”
Reviews.Author: guantanameraaa
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location for those who want to visit Berlin, especially if for the first time! There's no need to take any transport to get to Unter den Linden or to Gendarmenmarkt. The rooms are nice and large. Delicious Berlin style breakfast. Friendly personnel. Really good hotel at a good price!

Reviews.Title: “Great location; functional hotel with great value”
Reviews.Author: Globetraveler40
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel in May when attending a conference. The single rooms can be very, very tiny and so you want to make sure that you are in one of the larger rooms. Mine faced the street but was very quiet. No special amenities or frills but a great location and a great value. Excellent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, easy accomodation”
Reviews.Author: visitmae
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy, nice staff, overall we were happy with our stay. Annoying that you have to pay extra for wireless though. Otherwise it has everything a hotel needs...it's nice, clean, quiet, etc. and the location is good if you're a tourist. It's just a few blocks from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: made_in_ukraine
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very central to Berlin Mitte, which means the main sightseeing spots are easily accessible on foot. The receptionists were kind and let us check into the hotel before midday. The room was not big but rather comfortable in light gentle colors. Bathroom was spotless and had all basic amenities. The restaurant did serve a breakfast, however one can find a better deal in neighboring cares.

Reviews.Title: “Superb value, good location.”
Reviews.Author: richwork1
Reviews.Content: Winters Hotel Berlin Mitte is a throughly decent place to stay for those prepared to spend a few extra Euro's. We stayed there for two nights and managed to pick up a reduced rate making this hotel excellent value for money. I couldn't fault the hotel for the superb quality of their service, the cleanliness of the rooms and the quality of the bed and bathroom. We arrived three hours before the check in time but the hotel were more than happy to both store our luggage while we did some sight seeing and speed up the preparation of the room so we could book in earlier. Breakfast is served in the restaurant on the ground floor but there are many small café's offering "fruhstuck "along Friedrichstrasse if you fancy eating elsewhere for breakfast. A good example of alternative breakfasting options is the organic bistro on the street corner which offers terrific vegetarian breakfasts. However, the hotel restaurant only serves breakfast, there are no other meal served during the day. This might be a problem in any City other than Berlin where good, decent and affordable food is only a short train ride away. Located in a quiet residential area that pretty much borders Stadt Mitte and Kruezburg, Winters Hotel Berlin Mitte is well located for public trasport links throughout Berlin. The hotel less than five minutes walk from Kochstrasse U-Bahn station which is located directly opposite Checkpoint Charlie. The U6 U-Bahn line runs directly through the centre of Berlin linking directly with nearly all other U-Bahn and S-Bahn lines in the city. All in all, our stay at the Winters Hotel Berlin Mitte complemented an excellent city break for my partner and I. I would definitely recommend this hotel to leisure and business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “FAB Berlin!!”
Reviews.Author: SamanthaWalker84
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a really good area, close to the jewish mewseum and Checkpoint Charlie. It was pretty basic, but very clean and had a nice wee bar for drinks after a heavy day sightseeing. Would definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and good value”
Reviews.Author: youngozziebuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over Christmas 2009. The hotel is nice, new, modern and very clean. The staff are really helpful and friendly. The location is OK, it is in Mitte, not far from Checkpoint Charlie and close to the subway. We found ourselves in and around Alexanderplatz most of the time and as we like to be able to walk everywhere I would probably look for somewhere closer to the action!. Still, cant knock the hotel, especially for the price (we paid about A$70 a night). Didnt eat there however it seemed quite busy all of the time. There are some great restaurants nearby and an awesome Kebab shop for the walk home after a big night out.

Reviews.Title: “Super clean, friendly staff, conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: DaniML
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on a quiet side street with a 3 - 5 minute walk to the subway. From there you can get anywhere in Berlin to explore. The rooms/bathrooms are very clean and functional. The staff was very friendly and everyone spoke English. Internet was not free, but that seems to be pretty common in Germany. Rates are very reasonable. It was a great base for our exploring and we really enjoyed our stay! Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay off the beaten path. New rooms, euro small yet comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: travelsbydori
Reviews.Content: While this hotel touts location "at checkpoint charlie", it's a good ten minute walk from that location. Rooms are new and modern. Comfortable beds and pillows. Beds don't have top sheets, but do provide comforters. Friendly staff that speaks enough English to be helpful. Small bar in the lobby and a nice outdoor patio area. Make sure you have the hotel address handy for taxi drivers since most are not familiar with this hotel. No complaints. Enjoyed the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good weekend break location”
Reviews.Author: sally_83
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend and got good value as this hotel really felt like a business hotel. We requested a non-smoking room but because we checked in quite late we were given a smoking room for the first night. This was fixed for the next 2 nights. Good buffet breakfasts with cold meats, cheeses and salad (but expensive - there was a cafe around the corner that did good breakfasts for 5 euro). Excellent location, walking distance to Checkpoint Charlie and large sections of the wall.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a nice 3-star joint”
Reviews.Author: availablename
Reviews.Content: The Pros: We booked a double room, no breakfast for two nights as a base to go explore the city, and it worked out perfectly. The location of the hotel is great -- a five minute walk to a U station (Kochstrasse, in front of Checkpoint Charlie) but it's still on a relatively quiet street.. You can zip up to major train stations with ease -- in fact, you'll love Berlin's transporation system -- and if you want to walk in the area, Friedrichstrasse is a nice, lively area to check out, with lots of store and restauarants. Very safe, and everyone we came across was very friendly. The hotel staff were helpful in giving us directions and advice, and over all, I'd say they're pretty cool. Our room itself was spotless, as was our bathroom, which had a great shower (good water pressure and no clogged shower drain -- so common in so many hotels). The decor was spare, but modern and functional, and I even had a potted orchid on my bedside, which was lovely. The other reviewers are correct in saying that there's not much in English on their TV's -- BBC and Sky was it, I think, but then, we didn't go to Berlin to watch television, so just a spot of news in the morning and before bed was fine for us :) The Cons: While the bed is quite comfortable, there's no top sheet. So you get to use a thick comforter or...nothing. You each get one very thin pillow. You may ask for another, but it'll take a good while before it shows up. Also, we only had decaf coffee in our room. We asked for regular, but the woman at the reception desk just said she'd send someone to our room with it. Okay. We gave it an hour before gave up on waiting and just went out for coffee. They need to do a better job of nailing that down. And oh, no free internet wifi in the rooms. Tsk. Plus it cost 2 Euro for 30 mninutes in the lobby, which isn't bad, except that their computers were sooooooo slow and buggy (I saw others have this issue too). Don't use it unless you must.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you expect!”
Reviews.Author: LondonKiwitravelling
Reviews.Content: Although it was in an excellent location for Checkpoint Charlie and transport systems, the rooms and facilities were rather disappointing. The room was absolutely tiny, although it had a double bed, they gave me a single duvet and one small pillow - a rather uncomfortable sleep. The room didn't have airconditioning so had to sleep with the window open and the noise coming in. I was also under the imporession that the hotel had room service but on arrival they informed me they didn't do room service.....or dinner in the restaurant. This was definitely not 4 star standard!!

Reviews.Title: “Not really worth what you pay”
Reviews.Author: StasisWorld
Reviews.Content: The hotel claims to be 4 star. It's a 3 star - tops. While the reception staff were very friendly, the cleaning staff were abrupt. The room is tiny, so small that the bathroom isn't even in a seperate room. The shower is, quite literally, right beside the bed, the toilet is so small you can't sit down without hitting your head on the door. No room service which is a suprise from a 4 star hotel. Only a single lift to service the entire hotel (which means waiting a long time). While the location is good, there are better hotels in better locations.

Reviews.Title: “Spotlessly Clean - Minimalist - Almost Austere Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Iamalittleenglander
Reviews.Content: The Winters Hotel am Mitte is located very close too Checkpoint Charlie - which is excellent for those of us that have always wanted to tell the Taxi driver to "take me to Checkpoint Charlie" (I digress..... back to the review). Koch Strasse U-Bahn is 5mins walk away so the City is really accessible using your "Berlin Welcome Card" - make sure you purchase one one of these (any Tourist info office) - 69 euros for 5 days unlimited travel on Berlin's excellent public transport system, U-bahn, buses, S-bahn and regional railways - fantastic value and convenient!! The hotel is clean and very minimalist - great if you want a comfortable room and bed but it's not the place to chill out - the atmosphere in the reception is cold and utilitarian- Brrrrgh! The street (Hedemannstrasse) is not, as I have read it described here as, "quiet" but if you've done Berlin's sites justice during the day you should'nt be disturbed too much (I've included a photo of the view from our bedroom - nice:) I would recommend the Hotel - "it does what it says on the tin" - the location is excellent too - we previously stayed in Stegliz which took 25 mins to get anywhere - Hedemannstrasse is close enough to come back to quite quickly. Kamps in the direction of CPC is good for Coffee and Brochen for breakfast - I can't comment on the hotel breakfast - nevertheless the breakfast room looked as though it was designed to be functional rather than somewhere to dwell over your toast and Marmalade.......go enjoy..................

Reviews.Title: “plenty of problems for business traveler”
Reviews.Author: artspace
Reviews.Content: No internet. for 24 hours after my arrival for a 5 night stay. Staff neither explained nor apologized. There's no room service & to connect to Internet, you must go downstairs & get a voucher. Staff at reception speak little English and are not helpful. I needed to wash clothes - the nearest laundromat was four UBahn stops and a 20 min walk. No iron available in room. No top sheet on the bed, only a (small) duvet. I asked for a second pillow, top sheet and blanket - which I got (very unwillingly). Best news: breakfast buffet is great. If you have plenty of time and don't mind rude staff, it's OK. But if you're on business, have a tight schedule and don't speak German, think twice.

Reviews.Title: “would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: dlss07
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel to stay in with a fun and modern decor. The rooms are very well designed and it is a great value for money. We liked the location as we were only in Berlin for a short time and it was quite central and on a quiet street. The staff was really very helpful, giving us great directions to all the places we wanted and needed to go, and I saw them going above and beyond to help other guests as well. We skipped the hotel breakfast for cheaper eats in the city. The only negative thing that I can say is that the internet available on the lobby computers (which is charged by the minute) was quite slow for us, which was annoying. You can probably find other hotels closer to the shopping areas (they will probably be on busier and noisier streets), but if you are in Berlin for sightseeing, this is a great choice; we would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Kirsty38
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival i knew i had picked the right hotel! Reception staff were very friendly and helpful giving us city maps and their suggestions for where we should go.They also were very honest in advising us to not use the room phone as its 10euros an minute! we borrowed a adaptor plug from reception as ours wouldnt work.Nothing was a problem to them also everyone i spoke to on reception spoke perfect english when they realised our grasp of the German language is less than fluent! The room was very spacious and the bed was HUGE and very comfy we both slept really well.There were dressing gowns and slippers in the room for both of us and boxes in the batroom with goodies in which i loved! The room was perfectly clean and cleaning staff were also very friendly. The breakfast went on from 6.30am-11am which suits everyone there was a lot on offer and it was excellent great set up to the day.There are snacks avaliable at night time at the hotel but we ate out. The hotel is at the far end of one of the busy streets in Berlin close to U bahn and S bahn stations and about 15mins walk to the main part of Unter dem Linden.It is 5 mins walk from the Jewish memorial museam (which is a must see while in the city very touching,wonderful design of the actual building and excellent handling of a difficult subject) 5 mins from checkpoint charlie and the topography of terror which are also both worth a visit. The location of the hotel for me was good i dont think there is a 'perfect' location in Berlin as the city is massive (you would need at least a week to see everything) However It couldnt be easier to get around with a such a efficent transport system.I loved everything about this hotel and Berlin and when visiting the city again i would definetly stay here.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent, stylish hotel in the heart of the Checkpoint Charlie district”
Reviews.Author: cannl
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was a delight. It is quite modernly finished, clean and comfortable. as noted by other reviewers, the rooms are not very large, but for two people it was great. the staff were helpful and we found the location relative to sightseeing and the metro to be quite handy. The neighbourhood seems more residential, although not far away from checkpoint charlie, and it very quiet (we had a room facing the street and were not bothered by street noise). If you are looking to be in the centre of nightlife, perhaps look in a different area. One recommendation for the hotel: invest in wireless internet. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel to others as we had a very pleasant experience and felt it was very good value for the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Euroleague Basketball Final Four”
Reviews.Author: IngoGR
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a pleasant surprise in a totally excellent trip. A friend of mine and I booked this hotel because it was the cheapest one we could find (90 euros per night, 45 per person) but nothing felt "cheap" about it. The rooms were clean and stylish, not very spacious but we didn't care much since we were just looking for a place to spend the night and relax a bit during the day. It's location was great, really close to the subway station and near the Charlie Checkpoint. I would strongly suggest this hotel to anyone who is looking for something affordable and above average. After all you're gonna be in Berlin, what do you need a hotel room for? :-p

Reviews.Title: “Warm hotel”
Reviews.Author: tasosdavids
Reviews.Content: I expected it a much simpler hotel, but it proved quite modern, quite and very clean. The room was cosy, practical, with a large bathroom. Unfortunately, breakfast was expensive (12 euros per person), unlike other over-the-average hotels I have been. The receptionists were pleasant, polite and always keen to answer to your questions, although not always in correct english.

Reviews.Title: “great location retro rooms”
Reviews.Author: pookieManchester
Reviews.Content: just back from this hotel, very nice clean rooms there where 3 in our room and lots of space v quite nice staff, round the corner from check point charlie did not get breakfeast tho . would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Modern Rooms, Decent Location”
Reviews.Author: tjb42
Reviews.Content: Front desk was helpful, but slightly condescending. The room was small, but very modern and comfortable. Bathroom was very nice and modern. Well appointed. While it is only a couple of blocks from Checkpoint Charlie, the immediate nerighborhood of the hotel does seem to be slightly unsettling when walking in late at night. However it is only a couple of blocks to the sudbanhoff (metro). It was a good value, but I would probably explore other options if returning to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel All-round”
Reviews.Author: Hoppus
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Winters Hotel (Mitte) in May 2008, after finding on another website that the rooms were down from their usual £70-80 per night to a mere £40 per night. The location is fantastic, like many hotels in Berlin it is only a short-walk from a U-Bahn, and this hotel is only a two-minute walk from the Tourist hot-spot of Checkpoint Charlie. The Staff were extremely polite, helpful and courteous, whenever I asked for some information they gave me fully what I required, and also allow you to keep your luggage behind the reception when you have to check out ( not having to be at Schonefeld Airport til 20:00, I didn't fancy carrying a suitcase around Berlin for 8 hours). Another thing that pleased me was that my room had a safe, so I didn't have to take all my money and passport out with me all day and night. There is a breakfast buffet, which I think was/is 12 Euros, but if you would prefer something a bit cheaper there are plenty of cafes around nearby. I would definitely visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price”
Reviews.Author: FBV
Reviews.Content: I almost never give a 5 stars rating to a hotel in my reviews. However, this hotel clearly deserves it, attending to its price-value relation. It is a new 4 stars hotel right in the centre of Berlin, with nightly rates of a 2 stars motel in a suburb. I booked through its website a double room for 3 nights, at a rate of only € 58 per night/room. Unbelievable. Location is excellent, next to the famous Checkpoint Charlie, and in a walkable distance from many of Berlin landmarks, including the Unter den Liden avenue, Postdamer Platz, museums island, etc. The street in which the hotel is located is residential and quiet. Rooms have an adequate size, and they are very bright (my room 329 had 2 big windows) with a modern decor. Bathrooms are also spacious and very clean. Room temperature can be graduated and there is a medium size flat screen TV. Ok, there is no in-room safe or minibar, but what else can you ask for the rate paid (which was not an special offer, but the general rate)? Breakfast is not included in the rate, and costs € 12 per person (again, cheaper than the usual € 20 of the majority of hotels). Breakfast itself is very nice and abundant (buffet type). Service is correct (some of them friendly) and speak very good English.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beckster999
Reviews.Content: A great value hotel in a good location near to Checkpoint Charlie. The hotel lobby staff were very good and helpful. The rooms were small but very clean with a lovely flat screen tv, and a free roomsafe. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel, because at 12 Euros it was quite expensive. We saw previous reviews on this website that suggested eating out for breakfast as there were plenty of cafes nearby. We found a fantastic cafe just around the corner called "Delicious". The breakfast was only 7.95 Euros and it was delicious! Turn right out of the hotel, and then left at the junction. The cafe is only a few metres along Friederich Strasse. The hotel is very close to Kochstrasse U bahn station. We purchased the 'Berlin Card' that gave us unlimited travel for 3 days on buses, trains and the U bahn and only cost about 25 Euros. It also included the train fare from Berlin Schonefeld airport. The hotel is very good value for money, and an excellent place to stay while visiting Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer services”
Reviews.Author: mwyn
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via a secret hotel on last minute.com.We booked it because it was central. The standard room was ok but the bed was uncomfortable.The facilities were not those that you would expect at a 4 star hotel. e.g. when we asked about tea and coffee in the room we were told this was only for superior room 'people'. There was no restaurant, the breakfast was expensive and not to the standard expected in Germany. The staff were unfriendly and generally unhelpful. On check-out the clerk on reception tried to charge us for the water in the room (there was no mention of this in the room-4euros 50!!) and also questioned the fact that we only had breakfasted once in the hotel. When trying to get a drink from the bar at reception (no mini-bar) one had to stand around until the staff could be bothered to serve you-the telephone appeared to be far more important than a staying guest. The coffee was eventually nice but cold. So all in all we would not recommend this hotel unless you are ok with unfriendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jossip
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel. Room was very big and clean. Big bed, nice shower. Only things bad you could say breakfast was a bit expensive and it was two single quilts, but who cares. At the end of checkpoint charlie. We stayed for 3 nights and found that two long. The hotel is very trendy and a great price. There is a great italian place on the corner about 150m from the checkpoint charlie area. Bikes are a great way to get around and they have there on paths. Dont go up the big tower in mitte 9 euros what a rip. Two nights is all you will need. Hitlers bunker is a waste too cos there is no bunker. Great hotel and really cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Fine business hotel”
Reviews.Author: sups-mus
Reviews.Content: The hotel, located near "Checkpoint Charly" (does someone remember the door in the wall?), is fine for business stays at Berlin. Big rooms, well suited, fine breakfast. 4 stars worth.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: joylin
Reviews.Content: My self and hubby and 2 friends stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. It's in a very good location, just around the corner from check point Charlie. We did not have breakfast in the hotel as, it was not included in the rate, but saying that the breakfast room looked lovely. The bar was a different matter , just a bar (which is way over priced) in the lobby. If you come out of the hotel and turn left ,then left again you will come to a small residential area with a few eating places, and will take you into the gendermenmarket area. If you come out of the hotel and turn right then left you will come across a bar/hotel called the Anglietere. Avoid unless you want to spend 20euros on 4 half of lagers!! My self and hubby chose to upgradeto room 322 for the tea making facilities.. I would not recommend as it cost 60euros and as our friends said "that's a lot to spend to look at a kettle" To add insult to injury we had to ask for the milk and sugar each morning. On the whole the hotel was spotless ,and the young man who run the reception desk in the evenings was most helpful as opposed to the young girl in the day. If I visit Berlin again I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: Intelins
Reviews.Content: There are good hotels which you stay in and there are those remarkable hotels where you would just love to live in forever. The Winters is one of those Hotels where everything is just perfect. A room full of light with modern design, a spotlessly clean bath, great and friendly staff all around the clock and a central location which is ideal if you want to explore Berlin. All in all a perfect Hotel, which you must discover!

Reviews.Title: “Functional hotel in a good Location”
Reviews.Author: CLM78
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location and if you like walking, you can easily get to all the key sites such as Brandenburg Gate, Museum Island, Sony Center. It is modern and functional though unexceptional - don't book here if you want something special from your stay as it is little more than a comfortable place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “I absolutely liked it”
Reviews.Author: ILoveLondonandNYC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as a member of a group. The room was absolutely spotless and also big enough for two people to move around without stepping on each others toes. It had a flatscreen TV and a reasonable sized bathroom. The breakfast was plenty and very good

Reviews.Title: “Good but missing a few basics”
Reviews.Author: amancga
Reviews.Content: Location is good about 5 min away from Checkpoint Charlie station. Potsdam and Sony Centre about 15 min away as well. Hotel staff are quite friendly and room is clean and modernly furnished. Bathroom is immaculate. A few things were missing for a 3-star hotel though, such as a kettle, mini fridge, and alarm clock. But I still managed. The room I had faced the center courtyard and in the early morning was quite loud with the kitchen going-ons. However I'm an early riser and was not an issue for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: HansWest
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. The room was large, the staff was friendly and it was located close to the Koch Strasse metro and Check-point Charlie, but not too close.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves its current 7th best in Berlin tag!”
Reviews.Author: mmwain
Reviews.Content: Recently refurbished and in an extremely quiet part of Berlin but just round the corner from the U Bahn at Kockstrasse (Check Point Charlie) or 2 blocks from the S Bahn at Anhalter. There is virtually no traffic and if you arrived by car then I don't think you'd have a problem parking in the street. Nice room, nice bathroom, superb shower, no bath, room temp fine, double bed with single quilts a superb idea, brilliant for couples who like different temperatures!! Free safe is very easy to use. Flat TV on wall with usual free Euro and base channels inc Sky News, plus movies and porn as in pretty much any Euro hotel. Gave us 2 completely blank door cards which you just wave over the sensor on the room door and alse the door that separates the rooms from the public areas, a nice touch we thought. Delicious round the corner (towards CPC) does indeed do a good alternative Euro brecky for E8 rather than E12 in hotel. If you prefer cooked and are up late then after 10am you can get a superb omelette in the Italian 2 blocks left out of the hotel towards Anhalter - forget name but has a SommerGarten. Looks a little run down but food excellent. For the evening we recommend Café Orange on Oranienburger Strasse 32. Go to Anhalter and then take S Bahn up to next stop after Friedrichstrasse - the public transport really is the best way around in Berlin, you never have to wait and it all goes fast. The duck in blasamic sauce or the lamb in olive sauce are just superb and packed with taste - incredible value for just 11 Euros! Back to the hotel, the bar is completely devoid of any atmosphere, best bet is probably the bar round the corner to the left. We tried the bar of the Angleterre to the right and it was nice enough but ridiculously expensive. Better doing your drinking in town really - the public transport is still perfectly OK even late at night. Berlin seems to have a big problem with grafitti, some of which is actually very good, which does make it look more run down than it really is in some areas - but we were told crime is very low and didn't see anything to make us feel otherwise. Motorcycles are left on the street and still there the next day anyway! If we ever go back to Berlin and the Winters is still as cheap as it is now then we'll certainly be staying there! Tip, sign out front is just blue 'HOTEL'. The rest is there but very small, and the word 'Winter's' is almost invisible! Make sure you know where it is before you go - a policeman from the station just round the corner had no idea where the 'Winters Hotel' was, nor a selection of other locals!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value”
Reviews.Author: zipper12
Reviews.Content: This is a very stylish hotel located right near checkpoint charlie- not perhaps my favourite part of berlin but certainly very central and also close to an underground station. We paid 55 euros for a twin room which was fantastic value. As seems customary in this part of the world there was no fridge in the room but this was only a minor inconvenience- staff also friendly and helpful. Room was minimal but very clean and comfortable- not a place to spend a day but a nice spot to recuperate for a few hours between activities. Street reasonably quiet and windows double-glazed so noise was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money in Europe!”
Reviews.Author: CPH_Copenhagen
Reviews.Content: Compared with what you get, staying at the Winter's hotel in Berlin Mitte (By Checkpoint Charlie) is a very good deal. The room is big, everything looks new, it's clean and has plenty of storage space. The staff is very friendly and helpful also with suggestions for walks in the city. While the area the hotel is located in is not the most exciting in Berlin, the location is an excellent starting point for visits to the surrounding parts of Berlin. Here I can especially recommend the eastern areas of Prinzlauerberg, East Kreutzberg and Friedrichshain - or if you want to go shopping for the bigger brands on Kurfûrstendamm in Charlottenburg. A couple of minutes walk to the west of the hotel is the spa Liquidrom, which definitely is a good way to spend a couple of hours.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: YoungCoupleLiverpool
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the end of June 2008 for 4 nights. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from Kochstrasse U-Bahn and Checkpoint Charlie. Hotel has recently been refurbished and is very modern and clean with a good size bathroom and shower, flat screen TV and a safe (which was free). Reception staff were also very helpful. We did not have breakfast at the hotel but there are plenty of places to eat in Berlin at a reasonable price. When arriving at Berlin Schonefeld airport you can take the number X171 or X7 bus to ‘Rudow’ from bus stop 3 outside the arrivals hall, from Rudow take the U7 to Mehringdamm (in direction of Rathaus Spandau), then the U6 to Kochstrasse (in direction of Alt Tegel). We would recommend you buy a Berlin Welcome Card from the airport which covers you for unlimited travel on U and S Bahn trains and buses as well as discount off many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zmeczonka
Reviews.Content: - the location is not too nice, but the hotel is easily accessible between two metro stations. Rooms do not have their own air conditioning; temperature is adjusted by receptionist so it was too hot for us at night. Also, cleaning lady has a very strange way of checking if guests have left the room - she just enters the room without knocking, a bit surprizing. + the overall experience was v. good - the building is newly renovated, rooms are clean and nicely furnished. Bed sheets and towel are fresh and new. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - Not the Best Location”
Reviews.Author: weeguys
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights at the end of june 2008. Took two rooms one for my wife + i, one for our kids. Rooms were clean, bright + well decorated. Staff were friendly and helpful, as helpful as they needed to be (we didn't challenge them with anything). A little surprised that the hotel was 4* rated, more 3* we felt - facilities were quite limited, it's really just a good quality / good value room to lay your head at the end of the day, Berlin's too interesting to spend much time in your bedroom anyway. Location: This end of Friedrichstrase, around checkpoint Charlie is pretty quiet. Good for the Jewish Museum + some posh shopping, but otherwise quite dull. Having wandered around Berlin for a few days we were all left thinking that we would rather have stayed on the other side and to the east end of the Unter Den Linden. Didn't take breakfast in the hotel so can't say anything about the food.

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: lclaskow
Reviews.Content: Just right....good value, clean good sized room, nice shower, good bed, close to Kochstrasse U-Bahn stop. Interesting neighborhood just a couple of blocks from Checkpoint Charlie. Really liked it. Only downside, did not seem to be any airconditioning, but it was very hot while we were visiting and room stayed comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeTrav1984
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with a superb location near Checkpoint Charlie and only five minutes walk to the U-bahn stop at Kochstrasse. I bought a Berlin Welcome Card from the BVG stall in the airport when I arrived, which allows you to hop on and off the buses and trams within the city and gives reduced entry to lots of the attractions. I had a single room, which was was extremely clean and modern, and plenty big enough. I would definitely recommend this hotel for its location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: RolandT
Reviews.Content: Professional reception staff with very good English. Very clean room, not huge but plenty big enough. Very modern with new looking furnishings. Toiletries and shoe shine pad provided. Hair drier and digital safe in room. Shoe shining machines on every level. Lift (elevator). Breakfast was 12 euros and looked popular. We ate elsewhere as it's easy to find reasonable places to eat out.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi78
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Christmas. When we arrived on Christmas Eve there was a Christmas present waiting for us each on our bed! A lovely touch. We found the staff to be extremely helpful and friendly. The room was very spacious and modern. Comfortable bed. Everything about this hotel far exceeded our expectations. Fantastic value for money! Would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value hotel”
Reviews.Author: BlueIndyCardiff
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in a good location in Berlin. U bah station within 5 minutes walk allows easy access to the whole city. Hotel bar open through the night which helps as well. Rooms are not massive but very clean and modern and are big enough. Breakfast is about 12E and there is lots of it if you want to fill up before you go out. Staff are extremely helpful as well. Price is pretty decent so you cant go wrong really. Also while you are there go to a Hertha Berlin game at the Olympic Stadium - the atmosphere is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, newish hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mary014
Reviews.Content: Located very close to Checkpoint Charlie and only 15 min walk to Potsdamer Platz. The Checkpoint Charlie metro stop is 5 mins walk away if you don't feel like walking! Transport is excellent. Reception of hotel welcoming and helpful. The rooms are light, a fair size and clean. The bathrooms really nice. One point though, there is no mini bar - which is kind of strange when it wasn't built that long ago, also no air conditioning. That wasn't a problem for us - the bar in reception will let you take drinks to your room and will give you a bucket of ice if needed. We didn't have breakfast - it was around 12 euros each, but there are good cafes and take away shops nearby, for only a few euros. Overall I would recommend this hotel, it was value vs location and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at a Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: SF-Coast-Traveler
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Winters Hotel Berlin Mitte for five nights. This hotel is located near the Check Point Charlie with easy access to the Kochstrasse U-Bahn and Anhalter Bahnhof S-Bahn station. The building looks to have been recently remodeled. The lobby and front desk area had a contemporary feel. The front office staff were pleasant, helpful, and spoke English quite well. I found security measures at the hotel to be excellent. Your electronic room key is required to access the elevator and stairs to the upper floors where the rooms are located. The room was of average size for a European Hotel but had high ceilings giving the room a much larger feel. Furnishings were modern and contemporary.
