The TV was a 20" flat screen mounted to the wall over the desk. Internet access was offered at a reasonable cost. The bathroom was bright and modern and everything in the room was extremely clean. Unfortunately my room overlooked the inner courtyard so not much of a view. The hotel offers a breakfast buffet in the restaurant at a cost of 12 Euros; a bit expensive with the poor US$ exchange rate so I didn't use the restaurant. Overall, this is an excellent choice of hotels if you're staying in Berlin. I was able to secure a rate of US$120 per night (all inclusive) via Expedia. DIRECTIONS: From the Berlin Hauptbahnhof (Main Railway Station) take any of the following S-Bahn trains to the Friedrichstrasse Station: S5 towards Strausberg Nord S7 towards Ahrensfelde S9 towards Flughafen Berlin Schoenefeld / Spandau At the Friedrichstrasse Station, go down two levels to the U-Bahn station and board the U6 subway towards Alt-Mariendorf. Get off at the Kochstrasse Station (3rd or 4th stop). When you exit the train, go right and walk up the stairs to the street. This is Friedrichstrasse. Continue walking in the same direction, past the police station on your right and past Puttkamerstrasse. Hedemannstrasse is the next street on your RIGHT (about 200 yards further). Turn right. The hotel is mid-block on your left. Between the S-Bahn and U-Bahn stations close to the hotel you can get anywhere in Berlin quite easily. Potsdamer Platz is one stop north of the Anhalter S-Bahn station.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful deal! And right in the center of Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: ashoughton
Reviews.Content: Hotels.com was fantastic in helping me find this hotel. It is fairly new and all of the furnishings were so clean. It was right near the U-Bahn and all of the on-off tour buses went right by it because it was close to Checkpoint Charlie. From there, we had a very easy subway ride to the Pergamon Museum and it was also close to the Reichstag and Brandenburger Tor. We loved our stay there. In the mornings, they offer a fairly expensive breakfast (12 euros, which is a lot given the current $1.50 per euro exchange rate) but there was a Starbucks about one block away. We only had to tell the front desk that we needed a taxi, for example to go to dinner or a nightclub, and one would show up within just a few minutes. I highly recommend this hotel for the price, cleanliness, location, and professionalism of the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good combination of value, functionality and style”
Reviews.Author: jebworks
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers good value in Berlin. Location is near some key historic sites like Checkpoint Charlie and the Anhalter Bahnhof. It's a good base for exploring the former East Berlin quarter called Mitte. Offers internet access at reasonable price and in my room on the second floor the wifi worked as well. Service is attentive and the rooms clean and modern. Those facing the road are of large size, especially for Europe. Only advice to the hotel: place a washcloth in the room for improved showering....

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: a_klein13
Reviews.Content: Hotel is simply great not only because of the price which is very reasonable. Rooms are very pretty, modern with great bathroom. Also breakfast is awsome- with a selection of bread, rolls, cakes, great teas and coffee. Staff is friendly and helpful. Location -simply perfect (15 minutes walk to unten der linden). I would recomend this hotel to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: JenEricTravelers
Reviews.Content: Great location near Checkpoint Charlie and the Kochstrasse U-bahn stop. The reception area is neat, clean and contemporary. The front desk/all staff are very courteous and helpful. Breakfast is 12Euro/person but we found several places to eat along Kochstrasse as well as traveling quickly to Potsdamer Platz. The rooms are well appointed with wall mounted flat screen tv's with 2-English channels. The bathroom is very nice with a great shower and clean amenities. My husband (police officer) felt very safe with the security measures (card key entry before elevators and electronic door room lock) which is great for both of us.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: plexon
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through TA itself, just scrolled down the ratings ranking until I found this affordable hotel. And I only can agree with the high rating. Rooms are spacious, comfortable and very clean. Location is easy acessible, something like 400 meters from underground and very quite. No problem if you sleep in a street-front room. We were in the 323. High ceilings and modern instalations. Very good shower and hair-dryer. Don't hesitate, go for it !

Reviews.Title: “Spotless & great location”
Reviews.Author: lajoa
Reviews.Content: Hotel location was great. The best sleep I've had away from home (comfiest bed). The double is 2 twin beds pushed together but they do not slide apart and are not at all uncomfortable. The shower pressure was good & strong and most importantly a very decent size. FYI Ladies: hairdryer inside bathroom! The entire hotel & room were spotless. Furniture looks practically new .... very contemporary (modern) decorations. I have absolutely nothing negative to say about this hotel. Would stay there again and recommend it to all. (check out my pictures) Husband & I (in our early 30's with no kids) stayed here from 28Dec to 1Jan. Loved Berlin and enjoyed a 4hr walking tour (in English) ..... despite the fact that it was FREEEEZING this time of year. We seriously recommend/encourage everyone gets the 48hr or 72hr Welcome Card Packet which includes a ticket for unlimited public transportation (all buses & trains in Berlin) which is a must when navigating the city. The Packet also comes with a discount book for museums & other attractions, train system map & more. We are already planning to go back as there were many museums we didn't get to visit. The hotel lobby had a rack nicely filled with brochures (by the lobby vending machine). -We picked up a yellow brochure I think called "Insider's" and found discount coupons for the Cinestar Movie theater located in the Sony Center (Movies shown in original language which means a good selection in English). As an American I was shocked to find the movie theater has a full bar inside and they even sell alcohol at the popcorn concession. We didn't see any 3D movies as they were all in German. Sony Center is nice & I recommend it .... we walked to it 2x (yes even in the cold) it was a nice but not painful walk from the hotel. -The same brochure is also how we found out about the "New Pub Crawl" which we totally recommend. We later learned that the same group that runs the New Pub Crawl also offers a FREE walking tour daily .... bummer as we had already paid 9 Euros each for our tour earlier that day. The 9 Euros were still worth it so not much regret there. Tips: Hotel is located 2 blocks away form Checkpoint Charlie and train station. In the opposite direction the Jewish Museum was also about that much distance. There were many other attractions within very close walking distance. There are 2 supermarkets near the hotel: PLUS is located on corner of Kochstrasse & Wilhemstrasse (From hotel entrance walk to your left & on Wilhemstrasse make a right until you reach Kochstrasse). KAISER is located in a gray looking residential area behind hotel but this is the only one we went to shop for wine & champagne to ring in the New Year (from hotel entrance walk to the right and at Friedrichstrasse turn right again until you reach pedestrian area/residential area & supermarket sign can be seen at a distance). Now the following is just my personal opinion (welcome to disagree or agree with me): - 12 Euro breakfast not worth it. However, if you can afford it and/or are afraid to walk 2 blocks to Starbucks & other cafes near by .... so be it. We tried it only on our last morning there (1-Jan New Year's Day) because we were not sure if anything was open in the city but later noticed that all food establishments were very open & running at the main train station. - Internet prices in hotel were more expensive than the internet cafes near by so again .... if you can afford it, so be it. But don't be afraid to venture off the hotel for a better bargain. - New Year's at Brandenburg Gate was overrated. I was not the least impressed with the performances on stage or the fireworks show. Fireworks show was over too quickly. We got there at 8pm to make sure we got a good spot & froze for 4hrs till midnight & it was disappointing. I'm glad I still fell in love with Berlin due to everything else the city has to offer (lots of history & grand city atmosphere). - The Jewish Museum was highly recommended by people we met while doing walking tour & Pub Crawl but we never got to see exhibitions. It is one of the few Museums open on Mondays & it even closes really late on Mondays (9pm) so that is the day of the week we went. Berlin was super busy in terms of tourists due to New Year's celebration but that is no excuse to the rudeness we encountered from the STAFF there. We'd spent a good amount of time on a line just to get in and then discovered they had "airport-security-like" check-in process before you can even buy your ticket. With Welcome Card coupons we paid 11 Euros for the combo-exhibit ticket. However the ticket sales rep was extremely rude & further rudeness was to follow when we were told (not nicely) that they had sold out of Audio Guides & that checking our coats was a MUST! They had Polizei outside I guess guarding the museum & 2 regular men that turned us away from entering exhibits when they saw we had our coats on. Remember, our coats were already scanned by an x-ray machine upon entering museum. Meanwhile we saw others go inside wearing their coats & coat check-in queue was really long. We left, never got a refund & don't think we'll ever go back.

Reviews.Title: “A really enjoyable stay.”
Reviews.Author: quarrydog
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked the Winter's hotel for two nights when we went on our first trip to Berlin. As neither of us had been to Berlin before, we didn't know the best area in which to stay, so choosing this was just pot luck, really. We got a taxi from the airport so there were no problems finding the hotel, and the cab wasn't too expensive. The staff are really very helpful, polite, welcoming and friendly. Every person we talked to spoke perfect English. They are attentive and discreet. The room was very pleasant. Everything was spotlessly clean, and the bathroom was just as good. The double bed was two twins pushed together but it was impossible to tell once we were in! The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. The location of the hotel is also pretty good, within walking distance of various places of interest. We had a pretty dreadful meal in a nearby restaurant, but the English translation on the menu was so funny, it made up for the poor food. There is a metro stop within just a couple of minutes walk so you've got easy access to all parts of the city. So all in all, I really would recommend this hotel, and I'd certainly stay here again. The only drawback to our stay was that breakfast was not included so I can't comment on the quality of the food. But there are plenty of coffee shops fairly near by so you can always grab a bite to eat there if necessary. We had a great time at this hotel, and I really can't think of anything to moan about!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TravellerCu11y
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel location, only 100m from the underground station which is great for getting around berlin. The hotel was exceptionally clean and very comfortable, with probably the most comfortable hotel beds of any hotel i've stayed in. Modern facilities and restaurant, although we did not include breakfast with our rate to save more money...which was a good idea as there were coffee shops and bakery's 30 seconds away. Would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone. Value-for-money-wise i dont feel we could have stayed anywhere better in the whole city. Worth looking around for prices as we got double room for 185E for 3 nights, and although it wasnt the busiest time in berlin itself, still a great city with loads to do **Dont miss the 9th floor bar / restaurant round the corner 5mins away called solar bar. Unbelievable views of the city and excellent cocktails. At the top of an apartment block two streets west of fredrichstrasse (parallel) and near the accor hotels (ibis, etap)**

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in the centre of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: CarolienNorway
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights at Hotel Winters and I can confirm what most of the other people are telling in the reviews: this hotel is really value for money. Very nice room (single room with enough space, double bed) with design furniture. Walking distance to a lot of attractions like Checkpoint Charlie, Jewish Museum etc. I booked a room without breakfast (12 Euro) but there are several coffeeshops and bakeries around the corner in Friedrichstrasse, so it is easy and cheaper to eat breakfast here. Very clean hotel and friendly staff. The only minus that I can mention is that they were sometimes very late finished with cleaning the room...sometimes 16.00, so I came back in a room that wasn't done yet. But I can absolutely recommend this room. A tip: take the 2 or 3 days tickets for the public transport, much cheaper than the hop on-hop off offers. The city of Potsdam is absolutely worth a visit as well.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: eastlandingdweller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights on our first stop of a 10 day Germany tour. Berlin was more of a tourist attraction for native Germans, sort of like what Washington, DC would be for Americans. Could see most of what you would want to see in about 2 days. Nice, clean and recently renovated hotel. Rooms were very spacious and modern. We got a separate room for our two boys age 19 and 11 but they could have easily stayed in our room with an extra cot. Location was fair. A little bit of a hike to the center of attractions near the government buildings and museums. Public transportation system, however, is outstanding and very easy to use. Couple of nice coffee shops in area so don't waste your euros on hotel breakfast, way to expensive. Staff helpful except for one person who I think had difficulty with the English language.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a city break”
Reviews.Author: Dublin16
Reviews.Content: We arrived in this hotel and firstly found the receptionist very helpful. The hotel is bright and modern and the rooms were spacious enough with good bathrooms. Although there was no AC, it was not necessary as the weather was only about 18c celius. The location is very central, the hotel bar would have zero atmosphere though (but who drinks in their hotel when they're in berlin!?!?) and overall we were very happy with our stay. We paid about €280 for 3 nights (wed, thurs & fri) and overall I would recommend this hotel. However, that price did not include breakfast which we were advised was €12 per head. there's a nice cafe on the corner though so there was no way we were paying €24 for brekkie in the hotel! However, it did look good. (Also, there is free parking right outside the door which was very handy as we were driving across europe)

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Quiet”
Reviews.Author: rick138
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and quite. The rooms did not have AC and it was a warm week while I was there so this was a negative (no fan in the room). At night with the windows open the room would cool down but the room would get mosquitoes and we would awake to several new bites each morning. The hotel has two internet connected computers available for use, for a fee. The charge for internet access was a disappointment for the price of the rooms but this seems to be the trend in hotels trying to cater to higher spending travelers. The Breakfast was nice but not worth the 12 euros per person they charge. There are much better breakfast choices just up the street near Check Point Charlie. Would recommend a taxi to the hotel (10-15 min drive) from the main train station rather then trying to carry your luggage while using the underground.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent under-rated hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mandieree
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just a short distance from the metro, near Check Point Charlie, on a quiet residential street. The staff is helpful and all spoke excellent English. The rooms are small were very clean, and modern, and offered king size beds. We stayed two nights mid-week, and reccomend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: meeter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for eight days as tourists. Not particularly cheap with the exchange rate where it is but otherwise we were very happy with the hotel. Lovely decor'; clean, modern, pleasant, quiet, central location, helpful staff. We'd definitely recommend it to friends.

HotelInfo.Name: Winters Hotel Berlin Mitte Am Checkpoint Charlie
HotelInfo.Address: Hedemannstrasse 11 - 12, 10969 Berlin, Germany
